prompts.promptText: Show monthly revenue growth for last quarter

response.narrative: Here's the monthly revenue performance for Q3 FY 2024-25 (Oct-Dec 2024). Total quarterly revenue reached ₹34.2Cr, up 16.3% compared to Q3 FY 2023-24.
response.keyInsight: November showed the strongest MoM growth at 7.4%, driven by high document volume in Krishna and East Godavari districts. All 3 months exceeded revenue targets.
followUpPrompts: Which SROs contributed most to growth?

response.narrative: District-wise revenue distribution for the current fiscal year (Apr-Dec 2024). Krishna leads with ₹18.4Cr (15.2%), followed by Guntur at ₹15.2Cr (12.6%).
response.keyInsight: Top 5 districts account for 59.6% of total revenue. Krishna maintains its lead with the highest document count and YoY growth.

response.narrative: Revenue achievement against annual targets as of December 2024. State-level achievement stands at 78.4% of the annual target with 3 months remaining.
response.keyInsight: Q3 performance exceeded target by 6.9%. At current trajectory, the annual target of ₹154Cr is achievable with Q4 needing ₹33.2Cr (projected ₹38.4Cr based on trend).

response.narrative: Top 5 Sub-Registrar Offices by revenue generation for Dec 2024. SR05 (Rajahmundry Main) leads with ₹2.1Cr, contributing 17.8% of total monthly revenue.
response.keyInsight: Top 5 SROs contribute 72.0% of total revenue. SR05 has the highest document volume while SR01 has the highest average market value per document at ₹32.1L.

response.narrative: District performance ranking based on a composite score of revenue achievement, growth rate, compliance, and SLA adherence for Q3 FY 2024-25.
response.keyInsight: Krishna leads with the highest composite score driven by strong revenue achievement and compliance. Visakhapatnam has the highest growth rate but slightly lower compliance.

response.narrative: Bottom 5 districts by performance score for Q3 FY 2024-25. Vizianagaram ranks lowest with persistent structural challenges.
response.keyInsight: Kurnool has the largest revenue gap at ₹1.4Cr despite not being the lowest performer, due to prohibited property zone reclassification reducing volume by 8.2%.

response.narrative: Complete district ranking for Q3 FY 2024-25 based on composite performance index combining revenue, growth, compliance, and operational efficiency.
response.keyInsight: Top 5 districts exceed their quarterly targets. Krishna maintains its dominance with the highest absolute revenue though Visakhapatnam leads in growth rate.

response.narrative: Quarter-over-quarter performance comparison. Q2 (Jul-Sep 2024) showed mixed results vs Q1 (Apr-Jun 2024) with overall revenue declining 2.1% due to seasonal patterns.
response.keyInsight: While revenue dipped slightly (seasonal pattern consistent with prior years), risk metrics improved significantly. High risk cases dropped 10.8% and SLA compliance increased.
followUpPrompts: Which districts drove the Q2 dip?

prompts.promptText: Show highest risk SROs this month

response.narrative: Top 5 highest-risk Sub-Registrar Offices for December 2024 based on the SRO Integrity Index. These offices require immediate attention.
response.keyInsight: SR18 (Nellore) is the most concerning with a 5-point drop this month. Revenue compliance at 35% and 3 CFMS sync failures require immediate audit intervention.

prompts.promptText: What are the top revenue leakage types?

response.narrative: Revenue leakage breakdown by signal type for the current period. RevenueGap continues to be the dominant leakage category at 38.2% of total.
response.keyInsight: Exemption Risk and Cash Reconciliation are rising trends that need attention. Revenue Gap is declining due to improved detection rules deployed in Q2.

prompts.promptText: Which offices have exemption abuse alerts?

response.narrative: Offices flagged for exemption abuse patterns in the current month. 6 SROs show abnormal exemption usage above the 15% threshold.
response.keyInsight: SR18 has the highest exemption rate at 22.4% with 8 failed eligibility checks. State average is 8.2%. These 6 offices account for 68% of all failed exemption checks.

response.narrative: Daily cash reconciliation status across all 16 SROs for December 2024. 3 offices show persistent discrepancies requiring investigation.
response.keyInsight: SR18 has the highest discrepancy rate at 38.5% of working days, with average daily variance of ₹82,400. 11 of 16 SROs maintain 100% reconciliation accuracy.

response.narrative: Revenue forecast for Q4 FY 2024-25 (Jan-Mar 2025) under three scenarios. Baseline projects ₹35.0Cr, driven by steady volume growth and compliance improvements.
response.keyInsight: Baseline Q4 forecast of ₹35.0Cr would bring FY total to ₹155.8Cr, exceeding the annual target by 1.2%. Model confidence (MAPE: 5.8%) supports this projection.
followUpPrompts: Impact of MV revision on Q1 FY26

response.narrative: Analysis of the scheduled April 2025 Market Value revision impact. Expected to affect 8 districts with an estimated ₹12.4Cr revenue uplift in the first 6 months.
response.keyInsight: Net impact is strongly positive: ₹12.4Cr revenue gain vs ~₹1.8Cr volume-driven loss. Historical pattern shows volume recovers within 3-4 months post-revision.

response.narrative: Projected district growth rates for the next 12 months (NTM). Visakhapatnam leads with 17.8% projected growth driven by strong commercial activity.
response.keyInsight: Top 5 growth districts are all in the 'low risk' category with high model confidence. Kurnool (-3.6%) is the only district projected to decline due to prohibited property zones.

response.narrative: Comparison of previously forecasted values vs actual revenue for Q3 2024. The model showed strong accuracy with MAPE of 5.8%.
response.keyInsight: The model slightly under-predicted all three months by ~₹0.4Cr, suggesting the compliance improvement factor could be increased. Overall accuracy exceeds 96%.

response.narrative: Exemption compliance dashboard for December 2024. Overall compliance rate is 91.8% with 64 exemptions failing eligibility checks out of 782 total claims.
response.keyInsight: Compliance is steadily improving (+3.6% over 6 months) but still 3.2% below the 95% target. SR18 and SR09 account for 38% of all failed checks.

response.narrative: SRO Integrity Index for December 2024. State average is 72.4/100, up 1.2 points from November. 4 SROs in excellent band, 6 in good, 5 needs improvement, 1 at risk.
response.keyInsight: SR05 jumped from rank 3 to rank 1 this month (+3 points). SR18 dropped to 'at risk' band with a 5-point decline, requiring immediate intervention.

response.narrative: 6 SROs require corrective action based on integrity scores below 60 or declining trends. Recommended interventions prioritized by urgency.
response.keyInsight: SR18 is the only office in 'at risk' band and needs immediate intervention. SR14 and SR13 are improving and may exit corrective action in 2-3 months.

response.narrative: Stamp inventory anomaly summary for December 2024. 4 vendors flagged for usage deviation above 20% threshold. Total estimated leakage from stamp irregularities: ₹1.8Cr.
response.keyInsight: V-008 (Ganesh Stamps) at SR18 shows 90% deviation, the highest this quarter. This vendor's jurisdiction (SR18) is already flagged as at-risk in the integrity index.

response.narrative: 48 documents currently pending beyond the 14-day SLA target across all SROs. SR18 accounts for the highest share at 12 documents.
response.keyInsight: SR18 has 12 documents pending with the oldest at 32 days (2.3x SLA). Total revenue held up across all SROs is ₹32.4L. 72% of breaches are in bottom 5 SROs.

response.narrative: Average document processing time across all 16 SROs for December 2024. State average is 8.4 days against a 14-day SLA target.
response.keyInsight: Top 3 SROs process documents in under 6 days on average. SR18 exceeds the SLA target at 14.8 days average with P90 at 28.6 days, indicating systematic processing delays.

response.narrative: SLA breach trend for Q3 FY 2024-25. Monthly breach rate decreased from 9.2% in October to 7.8% in December, showing improvement.
response.keyInsight: Breach rate has improved 31.6% over 6 months (11.4% → 7.8%) but remains above the 5% target. Improvement is primarily from top-performing SROs; bottom 5 SROs still average 18.4%.

response.narrative: SROs with the longest average processing delays in December 2024. 5 offices exceed the state average of 8.4 days.
response.keyInsight: SR18's maximum delay of 32 days is 2.3x the SLA target. The primary bottleneck is staff shortage — operating at 60% capacity. Adding 2 temporary staff could reduce avg processing to under 10 days.

response.narrative: State-wide revenue assurance snapshot as of January 2025. Across 10 SROs and 25 active cases, the system has identified a total revenue gap of ₹40.85L against ₹1.52Cr payable (₹1.11Cr collected). South Zone leads in volume with 13 cases while Central Zone shows the highest gap concentration per case.
response.keyInsight: Central Zone has the highest gap-per-case at ₹2.34L — 1.4x the state average of ₹1.63L. SR10 Anantapur Main alone contributes ₹8.30L (89% of Central's gap) with the lowest officer accountability score of 48/100.

prompts.promptText: Compare all zones leakage rate this month

response.narrative: Zone-wise leakage comparison for the current period. State-wide gap stands at ₹40.85L across 25 cases. Central Zone, despite having only 4 cases, shows the highest gap intensity — driven by SR10 Anantapur (₹8.30L, risk score 80) and SR04 Kurnool (₹1.04L).
response.keyInsight: Central Zone's ₹2.34L average gap per case is 1.8x the South Zone average (₹1.33L). SR10 Anantapur accounts for 89% of Central's gap — primarily large-value sale deed discrepancies with market value deviations exceeding 20%.

response.narrative: SRO-wise exemption abuse analysis based on flagged exemptions. SR10 Anantapur tops with a 21.4% abuse rate (18 of 84 exemptions flagged), followed by SR06 East Godavari at 19.4%. Total estimated leakage from exemption abuse across all SROs: ₹54.75L.
response.keyInsight: SR10 Anantapur and SR06 East Godavari together account for 32 of 70 flagged exemptions (45.7%). The top abuse category at SR10 is 'Government Party Misuse' — private entities misclassified as government bodies to claim stamp duty exemptions.

prompts.promptText: Show all open escalations pending beyond SLA

response.narrative: 3 escalations have breached their SLA deadlines with no response from assigned officers. The most critical is ESC-008 — a ₹12.5L industrial property undervaluation case pending 46+ days with SR Vijayawada. Total revenue at risk across overdue escalations: ₹12.74L.
response.keyInsight: ESC-008 is the most critical — ₹12.5L potential stamp duty loss from systematic 25% undervaluation of industrial properties in Auto Nagar, Vijayawada. No response received for 46 days despite High priority. The same officer (M. Suresh Kumar) also has ESC-001 (Open) and ESC-006 (recovery in progress).
followUpPrompts: Issue formal notice to SR Vijayawada

prompts.promptText: Top 20 documents above 1 crore with payment gaps

response.narrative: Top cases ranked by payment gap amount. The 5 largest gaps account for ₹21.15L — 51.8% of the total ₹40.85L state-wide gap. SR10 Anantapur appears twice in the top 5, confirming it as the highest-risk SRO.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0003 (Tirupati, ₹5.00L) is already Confirmed status — recovery proceedings should be initiated. IGRS-2024-0010 and IGRS-2024-0020 are both from SR10 Anantapur, which has an officer accountability score of just 48/100.
followUpPrompts: Escalate New cases to zone DIGs

response.narrative: Comprehensive zone performance comparison based on SRO risk scores, case volumes, and gap concentration. North Zone shows the highest average risk score across its SROs, while Central Zone has the worst gap-to-case ratio.
response.keyInsight: SR10 Anantapur has the worst officer accountability score at 48/100 combined with a risk score of 80 — the most concerning SRO in the state. SR09 Nellore City is the best performer (risk 40, accountability 88, gap just ₹0.50L).

response.narrative: 3 escalations are currently overdue with no adequate response from assigned officers. Total amount at risk across overdue escalations: ₹12.74L. ESC-008 (SR Vijayawada) is the most critical — 46+ days overdue with ₹12.5L at stake, involving stamp duty evasion on IGRS-2024-0008.
response.keyInsight: ESC-008 is the most alarming — 46+ days with no resolution on a ₹12.5L stamp duty evasion case. SR Vijayawada's officer M. Suresh Kumar has not responded despite multiple follow-ups. Recommend issuing formal show-cause notice and escalating to DIG North Zone.
followUpPrompts: All escalation response times this quarter

response.narrative: State-wide exemption abuse analysis identifies 7 repeat offenders who have filed multiple exemption claims. Total exemption amount at risk: ₹1.25Cr. The top 3 offenders — M/s Ravi Infrastructure (5 claims, ₹42.5L), Srinivasa Reddy (4 claims, ₹18.5L), and AP Housing Corporation (3 claims, ₹87.5L) — collectively account for 71% of the total exemption risk amount. SR10 Anantapur has the highest abuse rate at 21.4%, followed by SR06 Rajahmundry at 19.4%.
response.keyInsight: M/s Ravi Infrastructure has filed 5 exemption claims across 2 SROs (SR02 Guntur and SR10 Anantapur), totalling ₹42.5L — a classic cross-jurisdictional evasion pattern. AP Housing Corporation's 3 claims amount to ₹87.5L, the highest single-party exemption exposure. Recommend freezing all pending exemptions for these 3 parties and initiating inter-SRO audit.
followUpPrompts: M/s Ravi Infrastructure full exemption history
Freeze pending exemptions for top offenders

response.narrative: Monthly revenue leakage trend from July to December 2024. Cases detected have grown from 16 in July to 28 in December (+75%). The total revenue gap has nearly doubled from ₹2.50L to ₹4.85L. October saw the sharpest spike (25 cases, ₹4.20L gap) coinciding with festive-season property registration surge.
response.keyInsight: December 2024 marks the highest detection month with 28 cases and ₹4.85L gap — both all-time highs. The upward trend suggests either increasing leakage activity or improving detection capability. September dip correlates with fewer registrations during Pitru Paksha period. Recommend increasing SRO audit frequency during high-volume months (Oct-Dec, Feb-Mar).
followUpPrompts: Which SROs drove the December spike?
Detection rate vs registration volume correlation

response.narrative: Recovery tracking across all 10 escalated cases. ₹7.20L has been successfully recovered (ESC-006, stamp duty evasion in Guntur). 3 escalations were justified with ₹3.44L in combined amounts cleared (ESC-004, ESC-005, ESC-007). 3 escalations are overdue totalling ₹12.74L at risk (ESC-008, ESC-009, ESC-010). 3 escalations are still open and under review (ESC-001, ESC-002, ESC-003).
response.keyInsight: Only ₹7.20L recovered out of ₹33.78L total escalated amount (21.3% recovery rate). The ₹12.74L in overdue escalations — particularly ESC-008 at ₹12.50L — represents the largest recovery opportunity. If ESC-008 is resolved, recovery rate jumps to 58.3%. Recommend prioritizing ESC-008 with formal enforcement action.

response.narrative: Your zone's revenue summary for January 2025. Total collection: ₹4.8Cr across 5 districts, representing 38% of state revenue. On track to exceed monthly target by 2.1%.
response.keyInsight: Nellore is the only district showing negative MoM change (-0.4%). Registration volume dropped 8% due to pending PP reviews affecting 12 documents.

response.narrative: High-value cases in your zone with payment gaps exceeding ₹40L. 6 cases identified with combined exposure of ₹3.4Cr.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0012 in Chittoor is 18 days old and approaching SLA breach. Recommend escalation to DR Chittoor for immediate review.

response.narrative: Comparative performance of all 5 districts in your zone for the current fiscal year. Krishna leads on absolute metrics while Nellore shows highest growth rate.
response.keyInsight: Nellore has the highest growth (18.2%) but worst integrity score (68/100) and SLA compliance (82%). Growth may be masking compliance gaps that need attention.

response.narrative: SRO-level performance ranking across your zone. 9 SROs ranked by composite score combining revenue, compliance, and integrity metrics.
response.keyInsight: SR01 Vijayawada Central outperforms all other SROs with the highest integrity score (86) and revenue (₹4.8Cr). Bottom 2 SROs need targeted improvement plans.

response.narrative: Current escalation status across your zone. 14 active escalations: 6 Open, 4 Responded (awaiting review), 4 Overdue. Average response time: 5.2 days vs 7-day SLA.
response.keyInsight: Nellore's average response time of 7.8 days exceeds the SLA. 1 overdue escalation (ESC-009) is 14 days past deadline. Recommend direct follow-up with SR Nellore.

response.narrative: Exemption usage patterns across your zone for FY 2024-25. Total exemptions: 628 worth ₹28.1Cr. Flagged exemptions: 14.2% (89 cases), estimated leakage: ₹2.1Cr.
response.keyInsight: Nellore and Chittoor have the highest flag rates (16%+). 5 repeat claimants span multiple SROs within the zone, suggesting coordinated exemption abuse.

prompts.promptText: SLA breaches in my zone this month

response.narrative: SLA breach analysis for your zone in January 2025. 18 cases breached their SLA targets. Overall zone SLA compliance: 88.4% vs state average of 91.2%.
response.keyInsight: Nellore's 18.2% breach rate is 2x the zone average. Primary cause is staff vacancy — operating at 65% capacity. Recommend temporary staff redeployment from Prakasam.

response.narrative: High-risk document analysis for your zone. 84 documents flagged as high risk in January 2025 with combined exposure of ₹6.2Cr. Krishna accounts for 35% of high-risk cases.
response.keyInsight: Guntur and Nellore show increasing risk trends. Guntur's market value underreporting is concentrated in 3 SROs along the highway corridor — potential organized activity.

response.narrative: Revenue vs target tracking for your zone in FY 2024-25. Year-to-date collection: ₹52.4Cr against target of ₹55.6Cr (94.2% achievement). Projected full-year: ₹62.8Cr vs target of ₹66.7Cr.
response.keyInsight: January shortfall of ₹0.5Cr is seasonal. To close the ₹3.2Cr YTD gap by March, monthly collection needs to increase to ₹5.8Cr (+14% over current run rate).

response.narrative: DR response compliance in your zone. 2 of 5 DRs have pending responses beyond SLA. Combined impact: ₹1.2Cr in unresolved escalations.
response.keyInsight: DR Nellore (P. Nagaraju) has the oldest pending response at 16 days — 2.3x the SLA. Given Nellore's broader SLA issues, recommend an in-person review meeting.

response.narrative: Your district's revenue for January 2025: ₹1.42Cr across 3 SROs, representing 96.2% target achievement. Krishna continues to lead the South Zone in revenue collection.
response.keyInsight: SR03 Vijayawada Rural is slightly below target (-₹0.01Cr). Low document volume in agricultural land transactions is the primary driver. Expected to recover in Feb.

response.narrative: High-value risk cases in your district with gaps exceeding ₹20L. 8 cases identified with combined exposure of ₹2.4Cr.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0012 at SR02 is 18 days old with no assignment. This should be assigned and reviewed immediately — nearing SLA breach threshold.

response.narrative: SRO performance comparison for your district. SR01 Vijayawada Central leads across all metrics while SR03 shows improvement opportunities.
response.keyInsight: SR03 has the lowest integrity score at 72/100. Cash handling and data quality components need improvement. Schedule a review meeting with SR officer.

response.narrative: Your district has 5 active escalations. 2 are assigned to you for review, 3 are assigned to SROs under your jurisdiction.
response.keyInsight: ESC-008 at SR01 is overdue by 4 days. You need to follow up with SR Suresh Kumar. Your own 2 pending reviews (ESC-001, ESC-004) should be completed this week.

response.narrative: Exemption claims analysis for your district. 184 exemptions worth ₹8.4Cr in FY 2024-25. 23 claims (12.5%) have been flagged for review.
response.keyInsight: SR02 Machilipatnam has nearly double the flag rate of other SROs (19.0%). 6 of 11 flagged cases involve the same party using different PAN numbers — potential identity fraud.

prompts.promptText: Payment gap analysis for my district

response.narrative: Payment gap analysis for your district. Total identified gaps: ₹1.84Cr across 42 cases. Recovery rate: 38% (₹0.70Cr recovered). Revenue signal accounts for 52% of gaps.
response.keyInsight: Revenue Gap cases have the best recovery rate at 44%. Focus recovery efforts on the 10 Market Value Risk cases — higher potential per case (₹4.28L avg).

response.narrative: SLA compliance report for your district. Overall compliance: 94% (state target: 90%). 4 cases breached SLA in January 2025, all at SR02 and SR03.
response.keyInsight: SR01 maintains perfect 100% SLA compliance. SR02's 3 breaches all involved market value verification delays — suggest fast-tracking MV verification at this office.

response.narrative: High-risk registrations in your district this week. 6 new documents flagged with combined risk exposure of ₹1.2Cr. SR01 and SR02 have 3 each.
response.keyInsight: SR01-2025-0142 has the highest risk score (82) with dual signals — both revenue gap and MV underreporting. Prioritize this for same-day review.

response.narrative: Your district's revenue vs target for FY 2024-25. YTD: ₹18.4Cr against ₹19.1Cr target (96.3% achievement). You need ₹3.8Cr in Feb-Mar to meet full-year target.
response.keyInsight: January collection (₹1.42Cr) is below trend due to holiday period. Historical data shows Feb-Mar collections typically surge 20-25% above average. On track for full-year target.

response.narrative: Officer accountability summary for your district. 8 officers across 3 SROs. Average accountability score: 76/100. 1 officer flagged for high cash variance.
response.keyInsight: K. Anitha at SR02 has the highest cash variance (₹2.8L) and 2 SLA breaches. Combined with high flagged exemption rate at SR02, this warrants closer supervision.

response.narrative: Daily summary for your SRO (Vijayawada Central) — 19 Jan 2025. 12 documents registered, ₹4.8L collected, 2 high-risk flags raised, 0 SLA breaches. Cash reconciliation status: Matched.
response.keyInsight: Processing time improved to 2.4 hrs (vs 2.6 avg). Both high-risk flags are for revenue gap signals on documents >₹20L — review before end of day.

response.narrative: Pending case summary for Vijayawada Central (SR01). 8 cases pending action: 3 new (unassigned), 3 in review, 2 awaiting external verification.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0128 is 8 days pending — approaching SLA threshold. Treasury confirmation has been requested but not received. Follow up with treasury today.

response.narrative: 4 registrations above ₹10L processed today at your SRO. 2 flagged for review based on automated risk scoring.
response.keyInsight: SR01-2025-0162 has a ₹28.4L sale deed with revenue gap signal — stamp duty appears under-calculated. Verify the document classification and applicable slab before releasing.

response.narrative: You have 3 escalations requiring your response. 1 is overdue (ESC-008), 2 are within SLA. Total revenue at risk: ₹82.4L.
response.keyInsight: ESC-008 is 4 days overdue — immediate response required. This is from DIG Rao regarding stamp duty shortfall of ₹48.2L. Prepare explanation with evidence documents.

response.narrative: Cash reconciliation for Vijayawada Central (SR01) — last 7 days. 6 of 7 days matched. 1 day (16 Jan) shows ₹0.8L discrepancy pending treasury confirmation.
response.keyInsight: The ₹0.8L discrepancy on 16 Jan likely relates to a late deposit — the amount appeared in treasury on 17 Jan afternoon. Submit reconciliation note to close this.

response.narrative: Stamp inventory snapshot for Vijayawada Central (SR01). Current stock balanced across all denominations. 2 denominations running low — reorder recommended.
response.keyInsight: ₹1,000 denomination stock at 34 units — will last approximately 3 days at current usage. Place reorder today to avoid stockout.

response.narrative: Exemptions processed at your SRO in January 2025. Total: 18 exemptions worth ₹1.2Cr. 2 flagged by the system for eligibility review.
response.keyInsight: The flagged Family Partition case involves a party that claimed exemption at SR02 last month for a similar property. Cross-verify PAN details before processing.

prompts.promptText: Payment gap cases at my SRO

response.narrative: Payment gap cases at Vijayawada Central. 6 active cases with combined gap of ₹48.2L. 4 cases are in review, 2 are new and unassigned.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0001 has been in review for 14 days — review status with the assigned analyst. IGRS-2024-0142 is a new ₹12.6L gap that should be assigned immediately.

response.narrative: Performance comparison of your SRO (Vijayawada Central) vs district average for January 2025. You outperform on 4 of 6 key metrics.
response.keyInsight: Your SRO leads the district on 5 of 6 metrics. Risk rate (3.2%) is slightly above district average (3.0%) — driven by 2 high-value cases this month.

response.narrative: You have 1 overdue response and 2 approaching deadline at Vijayawada Central. The overdue response (ESC-008) is from DIG regarding stamp duty shortfall.
response.keyInsight: ESC-008 is 4 days overdue. Prepare: (1) Stamp duty calculation worksheet, (2) Document classification proof, (3) Any applicable exemption evidence. Submit today to avoid further escalation.

prompts.promptText: Show all high risk cases this month

response.narrative: There are 14 high-risk cases flagged this month across the state. These cases collectively represent a revenue gap of ₹46.47L and require immediate attention. Anantapur district leads with 3 high-risk cases totaling ₹10.50L in gaps.
response.keyInsight: 5 out of 8 top cases are still in 'New' status with no reviewer assigned. IGRS-2024-0003 (Chittoor, ₹5.00L) is confirmed but pending recovery. Anantapur has 2 cases from the same SRO — possible systemic undervaluation pattern.

prompts.promptText: Cases with revenue gap above 2 lakhs

response.narrative: 12 cases have a revenue gap exceeding ₹2.00L, with a combined gap of ₹44.60L. The largest gap is in IGRS-2024-0003 (Chittoor) at ₹5.00L involving prohibited land transactions.
response.keyInsight: Chittoor district accounts for 3 of the top 10 cases (₹12.25L combined). Cash Reconciliation signals are emerging as a major contributor with 2 cases in the top 10. 5 cases are still in 'New' status — immediate triage recommended.

response.narrative: There are 18 cases in 'New' status across the state that haven't been picked up for review yet. The oldest unreviewed case is 9 days old. Combined gap at risk: ₹28.34L.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0001 and IGRS-2024-0005 are the oldest unreviewed cases at 8-9 days — approaching SLA breach threshold of 10 days. 6 out of 9 are high-risk. Anantapur has 2 unassigned cases from the same SRO.

prompts.promptText: Market value deviation cases in Krishna district

response.narrative: 3 cases in Krishna district have been flagged for market value deviations. The declared property values are significantly lower than the government rate card, indicating potential undervaluation to reduce stamp duty.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0007 has the highest deviation at 34% — this is well above the 15% threshold for auto-flagging. Both Vijayawada Central cases involve the same surveyor zone, suggesting a possible collusion pattern that warrants officer-level inquiry.

response.narrative: 11 cases flagged for cash reconciliation discrepancies across 7 districts. Total unreconciled variance: ₹14.30L. These cases involve mismatches between SRO collection registers and treasury deposit records.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0038 (Anantapur) involves suspected challan reuse — this is a critical fraud indicator requiring immediate investigation. 3 cases have been unmatched for over 10 days. Anantapur appears twice, suggesting systemic issues at that SRO.

prompts.promptText: Classification fraud cases with duty impact

response.narrative: 4 classification fraud cases detected where property type was misclassified to reduce applicable stamp duty. Total duty impact: ₹10.45L. These cases involve mismatches between Webland records and registration Form-I declarations.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0046 has the highest confidence at 92% — Webland clearly shows commercial zoning but the deed was registered as residential. Guntur accounts for 2 out of 4 cases (₹5.45L), suggesting a pattern at Guntur SRO that needs officer-level scrutiny.

response.narrative: 7 cases flagged for suspicious or ineligible exemption claims across 4 districts. Total revenue at risk from exemption abuse: ₹18.68L. Many involve government-to-private transfer exemptions being claimed on commercial transactions.
response.keyInsight: Government Transfer Exemptions account for 44% of total exemption abuse (₹8.30L) — primarily from Anantapur where both cases cite the same exemption clause. Agricultural exemptions in Guntur are also suspicious since Webland shows commercial zoning for those parcels.

response.narrative: 5 cases have abnormal delays between document presentation and final registration, exceeding the 10-day threshold. Average delay: 18 days. These delays may indicate processing irregularities or deliberate holds for document manipulation.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0023 (East Godavari) has a 20-day delay — double the threshold. East Godavari appears twice in this list. Combined with IGRS-2024-0006, this SRO has a pattern of processing delays that warrants a compliance audit.
followUpPrompts: Compare with state average processing time
Show challan movement trail for IGRS-2024-0023

response.narrative: 3 cases involving physical stamp paper inventory discrepancies detected across 3 districts. Total discrepancy value: ₹3.78L. These mismatches between issued stamp papers and physical inventory counts suggest either mismanagement or potential misappropriation.
response.keyInsight: IGRS-2024-0031 (Anantapur) has the largest variance — 45 missing stamp papers worth ₹2.50L. This SRO also appears in cash reconciliation cases, indicating broader operational control failures. Physical audit should be prioritized.

prompts.promptText: Top 10 cases by revenue gap amount

response.narrative: The 10 highest revenue gap cases across all signal types, ranked by gap amount. Combined gap: ₹41.85L, representing 68% of total state-wide gap. These cases span 6 districts and 7 different signal categories.
response.keyInsight: Chittoor appears 3 times in the top 10 (₹12.25L combined) making it the highest-risk district by volume. 4 out of 10 cases are still 'New' with no reviewer. Only 2 are 'Confirmed' — recovery action pending on ₹9.10L.
